result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo A Ocanas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 76 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid joint and several as a condition of probation. Restitution is for Walmart Stores, $828.00 and $1,397.84 and to Target $284.88.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency. Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.

No Contact with any of the stores listed in the criminal complaints or read-in list. No Contact with any of the co-defendants. Contct with brother with permission of agent only. Maintain full time employment and/or school. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ricardo A Ocanas in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.  Cases 14CF286 and 14CM911 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED.  Credit for 76 days if revoked.
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $2,510.72 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) as a Condition of Probation as follows: $828.00 to Wal-Mart Stores; $1,397.84 to Wal-Mart Stores; $284.88 to Target.
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.  No contact with any of the stores listed in the criminal complaints or read in list.  No contact with any of the codefendants.  Contact with brother with permission of Agent only.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
Motion hearing on August 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Motion for Bail Reducation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Attorney Sonderhouse  requesting that this case be scheduled for a plea and sentencing.
